title: Titan Submersible and Greek Migrant Crisis: Tragedies Reveal Inequities in World Attention
description: Many see harsh realities about class and ethnicity in the attention paid to the Titan submersible and the halfhearted attempts to aid a ship before it sank, killing hundreds of migrants. But there are other factors.

title: Wagner leader accuses the Russian military of attacking his mercenaries.
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, who leads the private Wagner force, has been scathing of Russia’s military leadership for months, but in videos and tapes released on Friday he took his criticism to a new level.

title: The Dark Incentives That Led to a Refugee Tragedy
description: To those who see refugees as a burden or threat, border security is a zero-sum game that can be “won” by keeping potential asylum seekers out or by forcing them into other countries.

title: Prigozhin Derides Ukraine Invasion as ‘Racket’ to Enrich Russia’s Elite
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, who leads the private Wagner force, has been scathing of Russia’s military leadership for months, but the 30-minute video he released on Friday took his criticism to a new level.

title: Modi’s Visits Abroad Help to Build His Image in India
description: For an audience in India, the prime minister is linking his diplomatic reception abroad, and himself, to the country’s growing importance on the world stage.

title: Expert Raised Safety Concerns After 2019 Trip on Titan Sub
description: After hearing a loud cracking sound during the dive, the expert, Karl Stanley, emailed OceanGate’s C.E.O., Stockton Rush, to urge him to hold off on future trips.

title: Pope Hosts Artists in Sistine Chapel, Even Some Who Attracted Controversy
description: The event was part of a broader effort to engage with artists as the Roman Catholic Church did in the past. Pope Francis also urged them to pursue social justice through their work.

title: Deadly Strike Hits City Still Reeling From Dam Disaster
description: Two municipal workers were killed in Russian shelling in Kherson, the latest deadly bombardment of the flood-hit southern Ukrainian city.

title: Democracy and Reality
description: We are covering Narendra Modi’s visit to the U.S., the implosion of the missing submersible and the N.B.A. draft.

title: Guatemala Votes for President, but Candidates Are Excluded
description: Guatemala’s first round of elections on Sunday is as much about who’s not on the ballot as who is, after courts barred leading candidates from running.

title: 88 Temples, 750 Miles, Untold Gifts: Japan’s Shikoku Pilgrimage
description: A famed route on the smallest of Japan’s four main islands offers breathtaking views and an array of lessons on history, culture and generosity.

title: As Lord Mayor, a 22-Year-Old Vaulted From Public Housing Into London’s Elite
description: Hamza Taouzzale became the first Muslim and youngest ever Lord Mayor of Westminster, a ceremonial post that outranks many of the capital’s most powerful and privileged.

title: As Lord Mayor, a 22-Year-Old Vaulted From Public Housing Into London’s Elite
description: Hamza Taouzzale became the first Muslim and youngest ever Lord Mayor of Westminster, a ceremonial post that outranks many of the capital’s most powerful and privileged.

title: A War-Themed Restaurant in Ukraine Finds New Resonance
description: A restaurant that celebrates Ukraine’s struggles in earlier wars is finding a second life in this one.

title: Washington Spirit’s Michele Kang Wants to Take Women’s Soccer Clubs Global
description: With the rapid rise of women’s soccer, Y. Michele Kang, the owner of the Washington Spirit, is in the vanguard of transforming ownership and management worldwide.

title: How NATO Blends Aircraft From 25 Nations
description: The alliance’s “Air Defender” exercises, the largest in its history, have focused on communications, particularly on synchronizing multiple encryption systems.

title: With a Hand From the U.S. Military, Aid Finally Reaches a Syrian Camp
description: “I saw people eating plants that are usually only used to feed animals,” said one resident of a camp for displaced Syrians that sits in the shadow of an American military base but has been cut off from aid for years.

title: On Aung San Suu Kyi’s Birthday, Flowers, Then Arrests
description: People across Myanmar wore flowers on Monday to show support for the jailed civilian leader. Since then, the ruling military has been rounding them up.

title: Canada’s Online News Act Targets Facebook and Google
description: A new Canadian law will require technology companies to license news content. Facebook’s owner said it would drop news from the platform.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: The discovery of wreckage from the Titan submersible.

title: Tipping Gets ‘More in Your Face,’ and Not Everyone Likes It
description: Tipping is not unheard-of in Australia, but an increasing number of apps and payment platforms are actively asking for an extra dollar, or five, on bills.
